stimulusHtml: Which of the following correctly indicates an action the student could take to increase the temperature of the gas, and provides a valid justification?

features.html: A student wants to increase the temperature of an ideal gas in an uninsulated cylinder that is initially at room temperature. The cylinder has a movable piston with negligible friction.

choicesHtml: Pushing the piston in very rapidly, because no energy will be transferred to the surroundings by a cooling process.
Pushing the piston in very rapidly, because energy will be transferred to the gas from the surroundings by a heating process.
Pushing the piston in very slowly, because the gas will have time to absorb energy from the surroundings by heating as it is compressed.
Pushing the piston in very slowly, because work will be done on the gas.
